final_answer:
The humor and satire in this image arise from the contrast between the two depicted figures. 

On the left, there's a serious and neutral-faced person with a swim cap in a swimming pool setting, suggesting a professional swimmer or someone taking swimming seriously. 

On the right, an abstract stick figure with a beard and excessive chest hair stands above abstract water lines. This figure has a humorous and unexpected appearance, contrasting sharply with the seriousness of the person on the left. The image plays with the idea of what we typically expect when we think of a "serious swimmer" versus the amusing, exaggerated portrayal of someone with comically excessive body hair and a simplistic stick-figure style. 

The satire is in highlighting the absurdity or unexpected nature of such a contrast in a typically serious context, creating humor through the unexpected element.
